summary: As the U.S. population ages, demand will increase for home- and community-based services that help older adults stay in their homes. But meeting this demand may be difficult, especially in rural areas. For instance, rural older adults may have: Less access to certain services, such as home-delivered meals Longer travel distances for health care, groceries, and support services—with fewer transportation options Fewer available caregivers due...
title: Older Americans Act: HHS Could Help Rural Service Providers by Centralizing Information on Promising Practices
